title: Glamorous gran who dresses in mini skirts and heels thinks she's "hotter" than her teenage granddaughter
text:
News Glamorous gran who dresses in mini skirts and heels thinks she's "hotter" than her teenage granddaughter Despite being a gran of five, Amanda, 55, says she would rather go out partying than stay indoors and knit or watch soaps Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now 'Glam gran' says she's hotter than her teen granddaughter Share this video Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
A glamorous gran who goes out clubbing with her granddaughter says she thinks she's "hotter" for her age than the teenager . 
Amanda, who dresses in mini skirts and heels, turns younger men's heads on nights out with her 18-year-old granddaughter, Emma. 
Despite being a gran of five, the 55-year-old says she would rather go out partying than stay indoors and knit or watch soaps. 
She also admits she believes she is "hotter" for her age than Emma - who says most of her friends' boyfriends call her gran "GILF". 
"I would probably describe my style as tasteful and classy for my age," says Amanda, who features on Channel 5's My Mum's Hotter Than Me. Amanda, left, thinks she's "hotter" for her age than her granddaughter, Emma, right 
"But slightly sexy 'cos obviously, you know, I'm not that old." 
She adds: ""What am I supposed to do as a nan at 55? Sit in and do knitting and watch soaps? Err, no, I don't think so." 
In the programme, Amanda, who started modelling in lingerie aged 54, is filmed getting ready to go out partying with her eldest grandchild. Read More ‘Human Ken Doll’ Rodrigo Alves has his FIFTIETH cosmetic procedure - and now wants Guinness Book of Records entry 
When asked who is hotter out of the pair, she admits: "I think I do look hotter for my age than my granddaughter. Sorry, Em." 
Emma, who describes Amanda as "bubbly, sometimes in your face", says: "Most of my friends' boyfriends call my nan GILF [grandma I'd like to f***]". The gran of five, from Bristol, started modelling in lingerie aged 54 Emma says: "Most of my friends' boyfriends call my nan GILF" 
She adds: "She cares about herself more than most nans, I guess." 
The teenager says she is happy for her gran to wear whatever she wants, but if she pulls on a night out, "I'll start crying 'cos I'm stood there alone". 
She also says that, if asked, she will tell strangers that Amanda is her gran. Read More Fancy space boobs? New breast implants are filled with material designed for shuttles 
The programme then shows the pair, from Bristol, going out drinking. With Amanda turning heads, a stranger asks if she and Emma are friends. 
Later, as the duo sit at the bar, a man turns around and asks if they are mother and daughter. He appears to be stunned to be told otherwise. Amanda's transformation into a party-loving gran was triggered by the tragic death of her son Stuart 
Amanda later says: "I feel like I've been out with my mate, not my granddaughter," while Emma admits: "She got the most attention." 
Amanda's transformation into a party-loving gran was triggered by the tragic death of her son Stuart - Emma's dad - in a car accident several years ago. 
It was "horrendous, absolutely horrendous," recalls Amanda. Read More 'World's most obscene climbing wall' has handholds in the shape of boobs, bums and PENISES 
"It changed my outlook on life completely." 
She adds: " They say life begins at 40, don't they? And some people say 50's the new 40. So I'm going with it... why not?" Mruga, 55, from London, also appears on the Channel 5 programme (Photo: Channel 5) The mum says she encouraged her "super hot" twins, Tasha and Tanya, to pursue their dream to become glamour models (Photo: Channel 5) 
Amanda and Emma are among a number of families to feature on My Mum's Hotter Than Me, which airs on Channel 5 tonight. 
Another clip sees a mum who calls her family "the Kardashians of the UK" reveal she's "proud" her twin daughters wanted to become glamour models. 
Mruga, 55, from London, says she encouraged her "super hot" 27-year-old identical twins, Tasha and Tanya, to pursue their shared dream.
